definition[0]: not well known and usually not very important
example[1]: The details of his life remain obscure.
example[3]: For some obscure reason, the group is very popular.
definition[2]: to make something difficult to know or understand
example[4]: Recent successes have obscured the fact that the company is still in trouble.
definition[3]: to prevent something from being seen or heard clearly
example[5]: The view was obscured by mist.
